title: I live here (Book Cover)
content:
Upon putting random words into amazon.com's book search, I came across an interesting book cover:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017185046im_/http:/typophile.com/files/book_cover_6744.jpg)

"I Live Here is a paper documentary–an intimate journey to humanitarian crises in four corners of the world: war in Chechnya, ethnic cleansing in Burma, globalization in Mexico, and AIDS in Malawi." -Barns and Noble

The cover design is very interesting, considering the subject matter of the book. I don't think I need to explain "I live", just that it has so much meaning given the subject of the book. It is all hand drawn type (in sharpie) on a wall that looks like it's been painted multiple times.

It's a funny thing for me, If given a decision I usually choose something pretty or comical, but the strong concept for this cover are what caught my eye.
author: srquresh
